goal.ch: This course will cover major American literary works from the Civil War to World War I. Some of the writers who are normally considered representatives of the American Renaissance will also be examined so as to give students a broader understanding of the literary trends and influences that took place in this period. We will discuss important texts by Emerson, Whitman, Melville, Dickinson, James, Gilman, and Chopin, among others. Topics we might address along the way include individualism, regionalism, gender/sexuality, romanticism/realism/naturalism, and modernity.
